TITLE: Like long Covid, the flu can also lead to long-lasting symptoms
SUMMARY: Patients who were hospitalized with the flu were at an increased risk for lingering lung problems, among other health issues, 18 months after their illness

TITLE: A new coronavirus variant has become dominant, but fewer people are being hospitalized this winter than last
SUMMARY: Wastewater data compiled by the CDC shows Covid activity at a “very high” level

TITLE: With Covid and flu surging at the same time, how big is the risk of coinfection?
SUMMARY: The most recent data from the CDC shows high levels of flu across the country and increases in hospitalizations due to Covid

TITLE: As the new Covid variant surges in the U.S., what to know about testing and accuracy
SUMMARY: Do we need to keep swabbing our nasal passages with Covid tests at the first sign of congestion or achiness? How well do at-home rapid tests work against the JN.1 variant

TITLE: Long Covid explanation in new study possibly paves way for tests and treatments
SUMMARY: Scientists say that drugs that calm a key part of the immune system should be studied in clinical trials as potential long Covid treatments

TITLE: In a break with CDC, California quietly changed its Covid isolation guidelines
SUMMARY: People in California no longer need to stay home if they’re symptom-free. Oregon implemented the same guidance in May

TITLE: Evidence mounts that Covid in pregnancy can cause health issues in babies
SUMMARY: Babies born to mothers who got Covid while pregnant had "unusually high rates" of respiratory issues, according to a new study

TITLE: CDC says it has no plans to ease Covid isolation yet, despite urging from doctors
SUMMARY: Public health is “more than controlling one virus,” one expert said, as federal health officials consider their next steps in the pandemic

TITLE: CDC may recommend a spring Covid booster for some groups
SUMMARY: People who are most vulnerable to Covid complications, such as older people and those with weak immune systems, may be able to get another dose for protection

TITLE: CDC recommends spring Covid booster for older adults
SUMMARY: People 65 and older should get another shot to protect against the virus, the agency said Wednesday

TITLE: CDC updates Covid 5-day isolation guidelines as deaths and hospitalizations fall
SUMMARY: The shift in guidance comes as Covid hospitalizations and deaths continue to fall

TITLE: Health workers fear it's profits before protection as CDC revisits airborne transmission
SUMMARY: The agency is developing a crucial set of guidelines that health care facilities will use to control the spread of infectious diseases for years to come

TITLE: Georgia puts Willie Pye to death in its first execution since before the pandemic
SUMMARY: Pye, 59, was convicted of murder and other charges in the 1993 slaying of his former girlfriend. The state had paused executions, last carrying one out in January 2020

TITLE: Covid vaccines not linked to sudden death in young people, CDC report finds
SUMMARY: The new report debunks widespread misinformation that the mRNA shots were connected to sudden cardiac death in young athletes

TITLE: The WHO overturned dogma on how airborne diseases spread. Will the CDC act on it?
SUMMARY: A new report comes as the CDC is updating its guidance for infection control. A committee advising the agency seems poised to brush the latest science aside

TITLE: A small summer Covid wave may be ahead, experts say, as a new variant takes over
SUMMARY: The variant, called KP.2, now makes up the largest share of new infections in the U.S

TITLE: Proposed North Carolina law would make it illegal to wear masks in public
SUMMARY: The bill, which would enhance penalties for people wearing masks while committing crimes, would also prohibit wearing masks in public for medical reasons

TITLE: New version of Covid-19 vaccine likely to come this fall
SUMMARY: An offshoot of JN.1 is now the dominant strain in the U.S., accounting for 1 in 4 new cases

TITLE: Moderna says its combination Covid and flu vaccine works well in late-stage trial
SUMMARY: The drugmaker hopes to launch the shot for the fall respiratory disease season in 2025

TITLE: 32-year-old man becomes fully paralyzed within days of catching Covid due to rare syndrome
SUMMARY: Dr. William Dugal experienced total paralysis after developing Guillain-Barre syndrome. After a year of rehabilitation, he’s back to working as surgeon

TITLE: FDA advises Covid vaccine makers to target new contagious strain for fall shots
SUMMARY: The selection comes as Covid cases are rising in some parts of the country

TITLE: The Covid summer wave is here
SUMMARY: Infections are most likely rising in at least 39 states, driven in part by a trio of new variants

TITLE: As Covid cases rise, CDC panel recommends new version of vaccine for fall
SUMMARY: The updated Covid vaccines should become available for people ages 6 months and older in August and September

TITLE: Biden tests positive for Covid and will self-isolate in Delaware, White House says
SUMMARY: The White House said Biden is heading to Delaware and will "continue to carry out all of his duties fully during that time

TITLE: What to know about variants and timing the new Covid vaccine
SUMMARY: Cases are increasing nationally, especially in the West and the Southeast, as three or four new variants of the virus are driving infections in different parts of the country

TITLE: Covid cases are rising: When to rest and when to test
SUMMARY: 21 states have very high levels of Covid, according to wastewater data

TITLE: Covid fell to 10th leading cause of death in the U.S. last year, down from 4th
SUMMARY: The disease represented less than 2% of deaths in the U.S. in 2023 — a large decrease from nearly 6% the year prior

TITLE: Is this the biggest Covid summer wave ever?
SUMMARY: A rise in Covid infections began in early June, and wastewater data from the CDC shows levels are still rising

TITLE: Covid cases on the rise: Is it too late for a vaccine?
SUMMARY: Timing the vaccines to match Covid waves has been an ongoing challenge for public health officials

TITLE: NIH study to pinpoint long Covid diagnosis comes up short
SUMMARY: Researchers pored over lab results from more than 10,000 patients from across the U.S. but couldn't find differences between patients with and without long Covid

TITLE: The signature symptoms of long Covid in kids
SUMMARY: A study reveals how the illness can present differently for school-age children and teens. Common symptoms include headaches, stomach pain, fatigue and muscle pain

TITLE: FDA approves new Covid vaccines from Pfizer and Moderna
SUMMARY: With the summer Covid wave still rising, experts say the timing for getting vaccinated is important

TITLE: Federal lawsuit challenges public face covering ban in Nassau County, New York
SUMMARY: Plaintiffs say that the Nassau County prohibition violates the Americans with Disabilities Act.&nbsp
